message.content:
cs.LG, cs.IT, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with sequential prediction and regret minimization, which are topics commonly studied in the machine learning and statistics communities. The use of logarithmic loss and side information also suggests a focus on classification problems. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is the most likely sub-category. The use of information theory concepts such as entropy and the analysis of sequential complexities suggest cs.IT (Information Theory) as a likely sub-category as well. The use of regularization and self-concordant barriers suggests a focus on optimization, which is relevant to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the use of lower bounds and complexity analysis suggests a focus on theoretical computer science, which is relevant to cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
